sn35.231:3.1: 231 The Simile of the Latex-Producing Tree
sn35.231:4.1: “Mendicants, take any monk or nun who, when it comes to sights cognizable by the eye, still has greed, hate, and delusion, and has not given them up. If even trivial sights come into their range of vision they overcome their mind,
sn35.231:4.2: not to mention those that are compelling.
sn35.231:4.4: Because they still have greed, hate, and delusion, and have not given them up.
sn35.231:5.1: When it comes to sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

sn35.231:6.4: Because they still have greed, hate, and delusion, and have not given them up.
sn35.231:7.1: Suppose there was a latex-producing tree—such as a bodhi, a banyan, a wavy leaf fig, or a cluster fig—that’s a tender young sapling.
sn35.231:7.2: If a man were to chop it here and there with a sharp axe, would latex come out?”

sn35.231:12.6: Suppose there was a latex-producing tree—such as a bodhi, a banyan, a wavy leaf fig, or a cluster fig—that’s dried up, withered, and decrepit.
sn35.231:12.7: If a man were to chop it here and there with a sharp axe, would latex come out?”
sn35.231:12.10: Because it has no latex left.”
